results.title: The Third man
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: A lucky combination of talents gave this romantic thriller, set in war-torn Vienna, an almost poetic quality and an excitement which has kept it vivid. The photogenic ruins provided a suitable background for the four star actors: Joseph Cotton, Valli, Trevor Howard and Orson Welles. Graham Greene wrote a bitter, well-timed script adapted from his own novel, Robert Krasker lovingly photographed and Carol Reed directed every scene with the surest of touches and then there was the insistent zither music by Anton Karas.

results.title: To the Lighthouse
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Virginia Woolf’s most popular novel. Set in a delightful holiday home in Cornwall overlooked by a distant lighthouse which holds a haunting attraction for members of this Edwardian family. A compelling story of family relationships.

results.title: Girl groups: the story of a sound
results.creator_credit: Steve Alpert, Stephanie Bennett and Delilah Films
results.brief_description: Traces the story of the dream girls, punctuating over 25 of their greatest hits with fascinating insights into what went on behind the scenes. Highlighted by rare original footage of the groups performing their hits. Includes : The Chantels, The Shirelles, The Shangri-las, Little Eva, The Supremes and more.

results.title: Laurel and Hardy's laughing 20's
results.creator_credit: Robert Youngson and Robert Youngson Productions
results.brief_description: In this compilation by Robert Youngson, Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy can be seen in highlights from some of their best work. Included are Putting Pants on Philip’, the film which made them a team;From Soup to Nuts’, in which they create havoc at a dinner party; The Battle of the Century’, with a spectacular custard pie fight; andLeave ‘em Laughing’, in which Laurel suffers a toothache and Hardy suffers Laurel. Includes many more highlights from the career of this famous comic duo. Rated: G

results.title: Mr Horatio Knibbles
results.creator_credit: Robert Hird, Hugh Stewart and Anvil Films
results.brief_description: Mr. Horatio Knibbles is a magic rabbit that only Mary Bunting can see. Mary’s mother’s jewellery goes missing but with the help of Mr. Knibbles and his friends, Squirrel Postman, Air Mail Pigeon and Mrs. Magpie, the real culprit is found. A live action fantasy. Cast includes Anthony Shepard as Horatio Knibbles, Lesley Roach, Gary Smith, Rachel Brennock, John Ash, Nigel Chivers. From an original story by Wallace Bosco.

results.title: Black Beauty
results.creator_credit: James Hill, Tony Tenser, Chilton Film Productions and Tigon Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted by Wolf Mankowitz from the classic children’s book by Anna Sewell, Black Beauty tells the story of a luckless horse who is passed from hand to hand but is finally restored to its original young master and has a happy retirement. Stars Mark Lester, Walter Slezak and Patrick Mower.

results.title: Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Byron Haskin, Perce Pearce and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A rousing, live-action adventure, based on Robert Louis Stevenson’s classic story. Young Jim Hawkins possesses a map of Treasure Island, and sets sail with a ship full of gold seekers. However, Long John Silver, a greedy crewman, quickly masterminds a mutiny, then gathers a ragged band of pirates to resume the treasure hunt…with young Hawkins as their unwilling and terrified hostage. Stars Robert Newton and Bobby Driscoll.

results.title: The Sword in the Stone
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A wondrous golden sword embedded in a large stone offers a tempting challenge to the strongest and bravest men in the kingdom - remove the sword and become the next king of England! When one small boy dares to accept the challenge, he unleashes a series of awesome miracles and incredible battles between the wizards in England. With glorious animation and delightful songs, this story is a Walt Disney classic.

results.title: Custody
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Film Australia and Tristram Miall
results.brief_description: Custody follows an estranged couple, Christine and Andrew Byrne, down the twisting and highly emotional path that eventually leads to a fully contested case in the Family Court. Along the way it shows the points of view of both parents, and the somewhat different view taken by the lawyers and the Court Counsellors who become involved. Above all, it dramatically shows what it is like to go through the Family Court. The members of the Byrne family are actors. The legal aid representative, the solicitors, the barristers and members of the judiciary all play themselves.

results.title: The Sky Pirates (Captioned)
results.brief_description: When their model plane crashes at the Aero Club, Mike and Harry are befriended by ex-pilot, Charlie Bradford, and his niece, Maggie, who teach them to fly radio controlled planes. Charlie invites them to the test flight of his new long distance aircraft which is later stolen. When they learn that a diamond has been stolen from the French State Museum, they realise the plane is to be used to smuggle the diamond out of the country.
